isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - INSTRUMENTS (New Data Link Driven Instrument Cluster) - OPERATION - INDICATOR AND WARNING LIGHTS

svcsubproc.title: Oil/Water: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Cummins ISM
svcsubproc.para: When the ECM senses that the oil pressure is low or the water temperature is high, the ECM will apply a ground at connector (1091)/pin 5. This will allow power to flow from the battery feed of alarm (R1) through circuit 28E, connector (26)/pin 5, the oil/water warning light, connector (26)/pin 10, circuit 97AZ, connector (333), circuit 97AZ, connector (3), and circuit 97AZ to the ECM connector (1091)/pin 5.

svcsubproc.title: Oil/Water: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Cummins M11E Plus, N14E Plus
svcsubproc.para: When the ECM senses that the oil pressure is low or the water temperature is high, the ECM will apply a ground at connector (320)/pin 1. This will allow power to flow from the battery feed of alarm (R1) through circuit 28E, connector (26)/pin 5, the oil/water warning light, connector (26)/pin 10, circuit 97AZ, connector (333), circuit 97AZ, connector (3), and circuit 97AZ to the ECM connector (320)/pin 1.

svcsubproc.title: Oil/Water: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Caterpillar C-10, C-12, 3406E
svcsubproc.para: The engine ECM monitors the oil pressure, coolant temperature, and coolant level sensors, and when the oil pressure or coolant level drops below a programmed value or the water temperature climbs above a programmed value, the ECM will set its connector (534)/pin 27 to a low state (ground). This allows power to flow from fuse F1 through circuits 28D and 28E, connector (26)/pin 5, the oil/water warning light, connector (26)/pin 10, circuit 97AZ, connector (333), circuit 97AZ, connector (3), and circuit 97AZ to the ECM (534), thus illuminating the oil/water warning light.

svcsubproc.title: Oil/Water: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Cummins L10-STC
svcsubproc.para: The oil pressure and water temperature sensors monitor the engine operating conditions. When the oil pressure becomes too low or the coolant temperature becomes too high, the sensor contacts close, applying a ground to the alarm and oil/water warning light, causing them to activate. The alarm receives power from fuse F1 over circuit 28D, and the oil/water warning light receives power from circuits 28D and 28E, connector (84)/(85), circuit 28F and connector (26)/pin 5. The warning light illuminates when a ground path is applied to connector (26)/pin 10 by circuit 29A/35, connector (85)/(84) or circuit 29/35 coming from the alarm (R1). The alarm (R1) will sound at a slow rate and the oil/water warning light activates when a ground is applied by circuit 29B/35, connector (2), and circuit 35 from the oil pressure sensor or circuit 29, connector (N/L), and circuit 29/E29A from the water temperature sensor.

svcsubproc.title: Oil/Water: 2000/4000/8000 Series With International Electronic
svcsubproc.para: The engine ECM monitors the oil pressure, coolant temperature, and coolant level sensors, and when the oil pressure or coolant level drops below a programmed value or the water temperature climbs above a programmed value, the ECM will set its connector (379)/pin 54 to a low state (ground). This activates the warning alarm (R1) at a slow rate by allowing current to flow from circuit 28D through the alarm (R1), through circuit 97AF, connector (22), circuit 97AF, and 97AG to the ECM (379).

Battery voltage from circuit 28D at the alarm is fed to the oil/water warning light connector (26)/pin 5. When the ECM (379) sets pin 54 to a low state (applies a ground), the oil/water light will illuminate and the alarm (R1) will sound at a slow rate as current flows through it, connector (26)/pin 10, circuits 29/35 and 97AF, connector (22), circuits 97AF and 97AG.

svcsubproc.title: Oil/Water: 3000FE
svcsubproc.para: The alarm receives power from fuse F24 over circuit 13B, and the oil/water warning light receives power from fuse F22, and circuits 28 and 28D at connector (10)/pin 5. The warning light illuminates when a ground path is applied to connector (10)/pin 10 by circuits 29/35 and 97AF, connector (15), and circuit 97AF from the ECM (379). The alarm will also sound at a slow rate when this ground is applied by the ECM in response to low oil pressure, high water temperature, or low coolant level.

svcsubproc.title: Oil/Water: 3000RE
svcsubproc.para: The alarm receives power from fuse F24 over circuit 13B, and the oil/water warning light receives power from fuse F22, circuits 28 and 28A, and connector (12)/pin 13. The warning light illuminates when a ground path is applied to connector (12)/pin 14 by circuits 29/35 and 97AF by the ECM (379)/pin 54. The alarm will also sound at a slow rate when a ground path is applied by the ECM in response to low oil pressure, high water temperature, or low coolant level.

svcsubproc.title: Brake Pressure: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Hydraulic Brakes
svcsubproc.para: When the hydraulic brake system monitor module (49) detects a problem with the brake system, it applies a ground to circuits 90S and 90T. The alarm (R1) receives power from fuse F1 over circuit 28D, and when circuit 90S is switched to ground, the alarm will sound at a fast rate. The brake pressure warning light is supplied power from fuse F6, circuits 28 and 28A, and connector (26)/pin 1. When circuit 90T is switched to ground, power will flow through the brake pressure warning light (causing it to illuminate), connector (26)/pin 3, and circuit 90T to the brake monitor module (49).

svcsubproc.title: Brake Pressure: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Air Brakes
svcsubproc.para: The brake pressure warning light is fed power by fuse F6, circuits 28 and 28A, and connector (26)/pin 1. When the air pressure drops below 60 psi, the pressure switch will close, and power will flow through the warning light, connector (26)/pin 3, circuits 40, 40B, and 40A, connector (2), and circuit 40 through the low air pressure switch to ground. This will cause the brake pressure warning light to illuminate, and the warning alarm (R1) to sound at a fast rate. The alarm receives power from fuse F1 over circuit 28D.

svcsubproc.title: Brake Pressure: 3000FE With Hydraulic Brakes
svcsubproc.para: When the hydraulic brake system monitor module (86) detects a problem with the brake system, it applies a ground to circuit 90M which causes the alarm (R1) to sound at a fast rate. The ground from circuit 90M at the alarm is also applied by circuit 90N to the brake pressure warning light, connector (10)/pin 3, causing it to illuminate. The brake pressure warning light has power supplied to it by fuse F22, circuits 28 and 28A, and connector (10)/pin 1. The warning alarm receives power through fuse F24 and circuit 13B.

svcsubproc.title: Brake Pressure: 3000FE With Air Brakes
svcsubproc.para: The brake pressure warning light is fed power by fuse F22, circuits 28 and 28A, and connector (10)/pin 1. When the air pressure drops below 60 psi, the pressure switch will close, and power will flow through the warning light, connector (10)/pin 3, circuits 40A and 40, connector (2), and circuit 40 through the low air pressure switch (717) to ground. This will cause the brake pressure warning light to illuminate, and the warning alarm (R1) to sound at a fast rate. The warning alarm receives power through fuse F24 and circuit 13B.

svcsubproc.title: Brake Pressure: 3000RE With Hydraulic Brakes
svcsubproc.para: When the hydraulic brake system monitor module (86) detects a problem with the brake system, it applies a ground to circuit 90M, connector and blocking diode (25), and circuit 90NA to the alarm (211). Power will then flow from fuse F24 through circuit 13B and alarm connector (211), causing the alarm to sound at a fast rate. When a problem is detected, a ground is also applied by circuit 90M, connector (25), circuit 90N, and connector (12)/pin 9 to the brake pressure warning light, causing it to illuminate. The brake pressure warning light has power supplied to it by fuse F22, circuits 28 and 28C, and connector (12)/pin 8.

svcsubproc.title: Brake Pressure: 3000RE With Air Brakes
svcsubproc.para: The brake pressure warning light is fed power by fuse F22, circuits 28 and 28D, and connector (12)/pin 4. When the air pressure drops below 60 psi, the pressure switch will close, and power will flow through the warning light, connector (12)/pin 9, circuits 40A and 40, connector (2), circuit 40, connector (169), circuit 40 and the low pressure switch to ground. This will cause the brake pressure warning light to illuminate, and the warning alarm to sound at a fast rate. The warning alarm receives power from fuse F24 over circuit 13B.

svcsubproc.title: Coolant Level
svcsubproc.para: This warning lamp is not used with electronic engines.

svcsubproc.title: Stop Engine: 2000/4000/8000 With Cummins ISM
svcsubproc.para: When the engine ECM determines that the engine needs to be shut down due to an engine protection scheme and/or idle shutdown timer, connector (1091)/pin 6 will be switched to ground and the engine is shut down shortly thereafter. Thus power will flow from fuse F6 through circuits 28 and 28K, connector (26)/pin 4, the stop engine warning light, connector (26)/pin 11, circuit 97AA, connector (333), circuit 97AP, connector (3), and circuit 97AP to ECM connector (1061)/pin 6. This will cause the stop engine warning light to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Stop Engine: 2000/4000/8000 With Cummins M11E Plus, N14E Plus
svcsubproc.para: When the engine ECM determines that the engine needs to be shut down due to an engine protection scheme and/or idle shutdown timer, connector (320)/pin 16 will be switched to ground and the engine is shut down shortly thereafter. Thus power will flow from fuse F6 through circuits 28 and 28K, connector (26)/pin 4, the stop engine warning light, connector (26)/pin 11, circuit 97AA, connector (333), circuit 97AP, connector (3), and circuit 97AP to ECM connector (320)/pin 16. This will cause the stop engine warning light to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Change Oil
svcsubproc.para: The engine ECM is programmed to track engine hours and vehicle miles, and when the programmed values are achieved, the ECM will apply a ground to connector (379)/pin 45, circuit 97AA, connector (2), and circuit 97AA to the change oil warning light connector (26)/pin 11. This will cause the change oil warning light, which is fed power from fuse F6 and circuits 28 and 28K through connector (26)/pin 4 to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Warn: 2000/4000/8000 Series With International Engines
svcsubproc.para: When the ECM detects a faulty sensor or circuit, it will set a fault code and turn on the engine warn light by switching connector (379)/pin 55 to ground. This allows power to flow from fuse F6 through circuits 28 and 28K, connector (26)/pin 4, the engine warn light, connector (26)/pin 12, circuit 97T, connector (3), circuit 97TA, and ECM connector (379/pin 55. This will cause the engine warn light to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Warn: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Cummins ISM
svcsubproc.para: When the ECM detects a faulty sensor or circuit, it will set a fault code and turn on the engine warn light by switching connector (1061)/pin 16 to ground. This allows power to flow from fuse F6 through circuits 28 and 28K, connector (26)/pin 4, the engine warn light, connector (26)/pin 12, circuit 97AT, connector (333), circuit 97AT, connector (3), circuit 97AT, and the ECM connector (1061)/pin 16. This will cause the engine warn light to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Warn: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Cummins M11E Plus, N14E Plus
svcsubproc.para: When the ECM detects a faulty sensor or circuit, it will set a fault code and turn on the engine warn light by switching connector (320)/pin 25 to ground. This allows power to flow from fuse F6 through circuits 28 and 28K, connector (26)/pin 4, the engine warn light, connector (26)/pin 12, circuit 97AT, connector (333), circuit 97AT, connector (3), circuit 97AT, and the ECM connector (320)/pin 25. This will cause the engine warn light to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Warn: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Caterpillar C-10, C-12, 3406E
svcsubproc.para: When the ECM detects a faulty sensor or circuit, it will set a fault code and turn on the engine warn light by switching connector (534)/pin 22 to ground. This allows power to flow from fuse F6 through circuits 28 and 28K, connector (26)/pin 4, the engine warn light, connector (26)/pin 12, circuit 97AT, connector (333), circuit 97AT, connector (3), circuit 97AT and ECM connector (534) pin/22. This will cause the engine warn light to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Warn: 3000FE With International Engines
svcsubproc.para: When the ECM detects a faulty sensor or circuit, it will set a fault code and turn on the engine warn light by switching connector (379)/pin 55 to ground. This allows power to flow from fuse F22 through circuits 28 and 28K, connector (10)/pin 4, the warning light and connector (10)/pin 12, circuit 97T, connector (15), circuit 97T and connector (379)/pin 55.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Warn: 3000RE With International Engines
svcsubproc.para: When the ECM detects a faulty sensor or circuit, it will set a fault code and turn on the engine warn light by switching connector (379)/pin 55 to ground. This allows power to flow from fuse F22 through circuits 28 and 28A, connector (12)/pin 3, the warning light and connector (12)/pin 15, circuit 97T, connector (2), circuit 97T, connector (198), circuit 97T and connector (379)/pin 55.

svcsubproc.title: Trac Cntl
svcsubproc.para: When the ABS switch (280) is placed in the traction control (on) position, power from inline fuse (299) will flow through circuit 13L, the switch, circuit 94BE, connector (13) and a black wire to the ECM (288)/pin F2. This tells the ABS module to enable the traction control mode. Thus when the wheel sensors sense wheel slip, the module will apply 12 volts to connector (288)/pin C2, the orange wire, connector (13), circuit 94BD, and connector (26)/pin 14. This will cause the trac ctrl warning light, grounded through connector (26)/pin 6 and circuits 28-G and 11-G to cab ground, to illuminate and the brakes to apply to the wheel that is slipping.

svcsubproc.title: Check Transmission: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Allison WTEC III
svcsubproc.para: When the Allison ECU detects that the transmission is overheating or that there is a problem with the WTEC III system, it will apply a ground to circuit 115 at connector (634)/pin 31. This will allow power to flow through fuse F6, circuits 28 and 28A, connector (26)/pin 1, the Check Trans. warning light, connector (26)/pin 2, circuit 92, connector (377), circuit 115, connector (418), circuit 115, and ECU connector (634)/pin 31 to ground. This will cause the Check Transmission warning light to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Check Transmission: 3000FE With Allison WTEC III
svcsubproc.para: When the Allison ECU detects that the transmission is overheating or that there is a problem with the WTEC III system, it will apply a ground to circuit 115 at connector (634)/pin 31. This will allow power to flow through fuse F22, circuits 28 and 28A, connector (10)/pin 1, the Check Trans. warning light, connector (10)/pin 2, circuit 115, connector (523), circuit 115, and ECU connector (634)/pin 31 to ground. This will cause the Check Transmission warning light to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Check Transmission: 3000RE With Allison Non-Electronic Transmission
svcsubproc.para: When the transmission temperature sensor senses that the transmission temperature is above 305 degrees F, its contacts close. This allows power to flow through fuse F22, circuits 28 and 28B, connector (11)/pin 10, the Check Trans. warning light, connector (11)/pin 6, circuit 31, connector (2), circuit 31, connector (196), circuit 31, and the closed contacts of the temperature sensor to ground. This will cause the Check Transmission warning light to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signals: Left Turn, 2000/4000/8000, International Turn Signal Switch
svcsubproc.para: When the turn signal switch is placed in the left turn position, power flows through the turn signal switch and orange wire, connector (459) pin D, circuits 56, 56S, and 56C to the left turn indicator connector (27)/pin 6. This will cause the left turn indicator, grounded through connector (27)/pin 2 and circuits 28-GA and 11-G to cab ground, to illuminate as the turn signal flasher blinks the turn signal lights.

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signals: Left Turn, 2000/4000/8000, Signal-Stat 910/915 Turn Signal Switch
svcsubproc.para: When the turn signal switch is placed in the left turn position, power flows through the turn signal switch and orange wire, connector (422)/pin D, circuits 56 and 56C to the left turn indicator connector (27)/pin 6. This will cause the left turn indicator, grounded through connector (27)/pin 2 and circuits 28-GA and 11-G to cab ground, to illuminate as the turn signal flasher blinks the turn signal lights.

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signals: Left Turn, 3000FE
svcsubproc.para: When the turn signal switch is placed in the left turn position, power flows through the turn signal switch and yellow wire, connector (13)/pin D, circuits 56 and 56B to the left turn indicator connector (11)/pin 6. This will cause the left turn indicator, grounded through connector (11)/pin 2 and circuits 28-G, 11-GB and 11-G to (J1) platform ground, to illuminate as the turn signal flasher blinks the turn signal lights.

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signals: Left Turn, 3000RE
svcsubproc.para: When the turn signal switch is placed in the left turn position, power flows through the turn signal switch and violet wire, connector (13)/pin D, circuits 56 and 56B to the left turn indicator connector (11)/pin 6. This will cause the left turn indicator, grounded through connector (11)/pin 2 and circuits 28-G, 11-GB and 11-G to (J1) platform ground, to illuminate as the turn signal flasher blinks the turn signal lights.

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signals: Left Turn, 3000RE, Douglas Tilt Column
svcsubproc.para: When the turn signal switch is placed in the left turn position, power flows through the turn signal switch and yellow wire, connector (13)/pin E, circuits 56 and 56B to the left turn indicator connector (11)/pin 6. This will cause the left turn indicator, grounded through connector (11)/pin 2 and circuits 28-G, 11-GB and 11-G to (J1) platform ground, to illuminate as the turn signal flasher blinks the turn signal lights.

svcsubproc.title: Antilock Brake Warning: 2000/4000/8000
svcsubproc.para: When the antilock brake control module performs a bulb check or logs a fault code, it will set connector (288)/pin E3 low (to ground). This will allow power to flow from inline fuse (299) through circuits 13K, 94F, 94L, the coil of the warning light relay (284), circuit 94H, connector (13), and a gray wire to the ABS module (288)/pin E3. This energizes the warning light relay (284), and allows power to flow through inline fuse (299), circuits 13K, 94F, and 94B, connector (297), and the antilock brake warning light. This will cause the warning light, which is grounded through circuit 94E, normally open contacts of the warning light relay (284), circuits 94-GB and 94-GC, connector (377), and circuits 94-GC and 11-G to cab ground, to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Antilock Brake Warning: 3000FE
svcsubproc.para: When the antilock brake control module performs a bulb check or logs a fault code, it will set connector (68)/pin K low (to ground). This will allow power to flow from fuse F27 through circuit 13J, connector (168), circuit 13J, the coil of the warning light relay (55), circuit 94H, an inline connector, and a gray wire to ABS module (68)/pin K. This energizes the warning light relay (55), and allows power to flow through fuse F27, circuit 13J, connector (168), circuits 13J and 94B, conn. (N/L), and the antilock brake warning light. This will cause the warning light, which is grounded through circuit 94E, normally open contacts of the warning light relay (55), circuit 94G, connector (168), and circuit 94G to platform ground (J1), to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Retarder On: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Allison AT, International Engines and ABS
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch is in the ignition or start position, power from fuse F4 flows through circuit 97K, connector (3), circuits 97K and 24B, connector (372), circuit 92R, connector (758), circuits 92R and 92N, and the retarder enable relay's coil. When the retarder on/off switch (917) is moved to the on position, a ground is applied to ECM connector (379)/pin 15 by circuit 24, connector (3), circuit 24, connector (377), circuit 24, switch (917), circuit 94-GC, connector (377), and circuits 94-GC and 11-G to cab ground. This causes the ECM (379) to switch pin 47 low (to apply a ground), and power to flow through the enable relay's coil and circuit 92T, an inline connector (N/L), circuit 92T, connector (372), circuit 24A, and the ECM at connector (379)/pin 47.

This will activate the retarder enable relay, and allow power to flow from inline fuse (664) through circuit 92A, retarder enable relay (996) normally open contacts, circuit 92P, the contacts of the ABS retarder interrupt relay (286) (provided that the ABS is not overriding the retarder), circuit 92D, connector (758), circuit 92D, low speed cut off switch (759), circuit 92E, connector (758), and circuits 92E and 92L to the retarder on indicator (926). This will cause the indicator, which is grounded through circuits 92-GD and 92-GC, connector (377), and circuits 94-GC and 11-G, to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Retarder On: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Allison AT, International Engines and Without ABS
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch is in the ignition or start position, power from fuse F4 flows through circuit 97K, connector (3), circuits 97K and 24B, connector (372), circuit 92R, connector (758), circuit 92R, and the retarder enable relay's coil. When the retarder on/off switch (917) is moved to the on position, a ground is applied to ECM connector (379)/pin 15 by circuit 24, connector (3), circuit 24, connector (377), circuit 24, switch (917), circuit 94-GC, connector (377), and circuits 94-GC and 11-G to cab ground. This causes the ECM (379) to switch pin 47 low (to apply a ground), and power to flow through the enable relay's coil and circuit 92T, an inline connector (N/L), circuit 92T, connector (372), circuit 24A, and the ECM at connector (379)/pin 47. This will activate the retarder, enable relay, and allow power to flow from inline fuse (664) through circuit 92A, retarder enable relay (996) normally open contacts, circuit 92D, connector (758), circuit 92D, low speed cut off switch (759), circuit 92E, connector (758), and circuits 92E and 92L to the retarder on indicator (926). This will cause the indicator, which is grounded through circuits 92-GD and 92-GC, connector (377), and circuits 94-GC and 11-G, to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Retarder On: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Allison MD and International Engines
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch is in the ignition or start position, power from fuse F4 flows through circuit 97K, connector (3), circuits 97K and 24B, connector (372), circuit 24B, connector (789), circuit 24B, and the retarder enable relay coil (790). When the retarder on/off switch (917) is moved to the on position, a ground is applied to ECM connector (379)/pin 15 by circuit 24, connector (3), circuit 24, connector (377), circuit 24, connector (377), circuit 24V, switch (917), circuits 92-G, 92-GY, 94-GC, connector (377), and circuits 94-GC and 11-G to cab ground. This causes the ECM (379) to switch pin 47 low (to apply a ground), and power to flow through the enable relay coil and circuit 24A, connector (789), circuit 24A, connector (372), circuit 24A, and the ECM at connector (379)/pin 47. This will activate the retarder enable relay, and complete a ground circuit from connector (632)/pin 31, circuits 161 and 161D, the relay's normally open contacts, and circuit 163 to ECU connector (634)/pin 27. The retarder warning light relay (791), which receives power from fuse F4 through the same circuits as the retarder enable relay (790) [listed above] and circuit 146H to its coil and also circuit 146F to its contacts, will become de-energized when the ECU removes its ground to circuit 125 at connector (632)/pin 18. This will allow power to flow through the contacts of the de-energized warning light relay (791), circuit 92H, connector (499), and circuit 92H to the retarder on warning light. This will cause the warning light, which is grounded through circuits 92-GZ, 92-GY, and 94-GC, connector (337), and circuits 94-GC and 11-G to cab ground, to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Change Trans Filter: 3000RE
svcsubproc.para: For vehicles equipped with the automatic transmission filter warning light, power is supplied to fuse F10, circuit 31D, and the filter warning light (94). When the key switch (20) is held in the start position, power will flow through the filter warning light (94), circuit 31-GA, connector (344), a blue wire, and the pigtail of the filter pressure differential switch. This power will flow through the normally closed contacts of the pressure switch and its connector, a green wire, connector (344), circuit 31-GB, blocking diode (64), circuits 31-GC and 31-GD, and the key switch ground, thus causing the warning light to illuminate for a bulb check. When the transmission filter becomes restricted, the pressure differential switch's normally open contacts will close and power will flow through the warning light to the switch as above, but the power will flow through the normally open contacts of the switch and its connector, a brown wire, connector (344) and circuit 11-GE to platform ground, thus illuminating the change trans filter warning light.

svcsubproc.title: Retarder Overheat: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Allison AT
svcsubproc.para: The retarder overheat light (925) receives power from fuse F4, circuit 97K, connector (3), circuits 97K and 24B, connector (372), circuit 92R, connector (758), and circuits 92R and 92H. When the transmission begins to overheat, the contacts of the temperature switch will close and a ground path through circuit 92F, connector (758), and circuit 92F is applied to the warning light (925), causing it to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Retarder Overheat: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Allison MD
svcsubproc.para: When the transmission ECU detects that the transmission retarder is overheating, it will apply a ground (switch to low state) to (632)/pin 19 and circuit 105, connector (499), circuit 105 and the retarder overheat warning light. Thus the light that receives power from the key switch (24), circuit 13J, connector (377), circuit 13J, connector (377) and circuit 13Z will illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Alternator
svcsubproc.para: The alternator warning light is not currently used in the 2000, 3000, 4000 or 8000 Series models.

svcsubproc.title: HI Beam: 2000/4000/8000 With International Turn Signal Switch
svcsubproc.para: When the headlight switch (35) is moved to the on position and the dimmer switch is placed in the high beam position (turn signal arm is pushed away from the driver), the lift to dim headlight relay (274) will be de-energized. Thus power will flow from the headlight switch (35) through circuit 51A, the normally closed contacts of relay at (274), circuits 52C and 52A, and the high beam indicator lamp at connector (27)/pin 4. Thus the lamp, grounded through connector (27)/pin 2 and circuits 28-GA and 11-G to cab ground, will illuminate, indicating that the headlights are on and the dimmer switch is in the high beam position.

svcsubproc.title: HI Beam: 2000/4000/8000 With Signal-Stat 910 Turn Signal Switch
svcsubproc.para: When the headlight switch (35) is moved to the on position and the floor-mounted dimmer switch is placed in the high beam position, power will flow through the headlight switch, circuits 51 and 51F, connector (17B), the green wire, contacts and brown wire of the floor-mounted dimmer switch, connector (17B), and circuits 52F and 52A to the high beam indicator lamp at connector (27)/pin 4. Thus the lamp, grounded through connector (27)/pin 2 and circuits 28-GA and 11-G to cab ground, will illuminate, indicating that the headlights are on and the dimmer switch is in the high beam position.

svcsubproc.title: HI Beam: 2000/4000/8000 With Signal-Stat 915 Turn Signal Switch With Push Button Dimmer Switch
svcsubproc.para: When the headlight switch (35) is moved to the on position and the turn signal lever-mounted push button dimmer switch is in the high beam position, power will flow from fuse F7 through circuits 63 and 50E, the coil of dimmer relay (276), circuit 51-GA, push button dimmer switch connector (421), a white wire, the switch contacts, a white wire, connector (421), and circuits 52-GA and 11-G to ground. This energizes the dimmer relay and allows power to flow from headlight switch (35) through circuits 51 and 51F, connector (17), circuit 51B, the normally open contacts of the dimmer relay (276), circuit 52D, connector (17), circuits 52F and 52A, and the high beam indicator lamp at connector (27)/pin 4. Thus the lamp, grounded through connector (27)/pin 2 and circuits 28-GA and 11-G to cab ground, will illuminate, indicating that the headlights are on and the dimmer switch is in the high beam position.

svcsubproc.title: HI Beam: 3000FE
svcsubproc.para: When the headlight switch (35) is moved to the on position and the dimmer switch is placed in the high beam position, power will flow through circuit 51, dimmer switch conn. (27), a green wire, the switch contacts, a brown wire, connector (27), circuits 52B and 52A, and the high beam indicator lamp and connector (11)/pin 4. Thus the lamp, grounded through connector (11)/pin 2 and circuits 28-G, 11-GB and 11-G to platform ground (J1), will illuminate, indicating that the headlights are on and the dimmer switch is in the high beam position.

svcsubproc.title: HI Beam: 3000RE With Douglas Turn Signal Switch
svcsubproc.para: When the headlight switch (23) is moved to the on position and the dimmer switch (4) is placed in the high beam position, power will flow through circuit 51, dimmer switch conn. (4), a green wire, the switch contacts, a brown wire, connector (4), circuits 52 and 52A, and the high beam indicator lamp and connector (11)/pin 4. Thus the lamp, grounded through connector (11)/pin 2 and circuits 28-G, 11-GB and 11-G to platform ground (J1), will illuminate, indicating that the headlights are on and the dimmer switch is in the high beam position.

svcsubproc.title: HI Beam: 3000RE With International Turn Signal Switch
svcsubproc.para: When the headlight switch (23) is moved to the on position and the dimmer switch (6) is placed in the high beam position, power will flow through circuit 66, connector (24), circuit 51A, the normally closed contacts of lift-to-dim headlight relay (100), circuits 52C and 52A, and the high beam indicator lamp and connector (11)/pin 4. Thus the lamp, grounded through connector (11)/pin 2 and circuits 28-G, 11-GB and 11-G to platform ground (J1), will illuminate, indicating that the headlights are on and the dimmer switch is in the high beam position.

svcsubproc.title: Right Turn Indicator: 2000/4000/8000 With International Turn Signal Switch
svcsubproc.para: When the turn signal switch is placed in the right turn position, power flows through the turn signal switch and blue wire, connector (459)/pin F, circuits 57, 57S, and 57C to the right turn indicator connector (27)/pin 12. This will cause the right turn indicator, grounded through connector (27)/pin 2 and circuits 28-GA and 11-G to cab ground, to illuminate as the turn signal flasher blinks the turn signal lights.

svcsubproc.title: Right Turn Indicator: 2000/4000/8000 With Signal-Stat 910/915 Turn Signal Switch
svcsubproc.para: When the turn signal switch is placed in the right turn position, power flows through the turn signal switch and blue wire, connector (422)/pin A, circuits 57 and 57C to the right turn indicator connector (27)/pin 12. This will cause the right turn indicator, grounded through connector (27)/pin 2 and circuits 28-GA and 11-G to cab ground, to illuminate as the turn signal flasher blinks the turn signal lights.

svcsubproc.title: Right Turn Indicator: 3000FE
svcsubproc.para: When the turn signal switch is placed in the right turn position, power flows through the turn signal switch and light blue wire, connector (13)/pin F, circuits 57 and 57B to the right turn indicator connector (11)/pin 12. This will cause the right turn indicator, grounded through connector (11) pin 2 and circuits 28-G, 11-GB and 11-G to (J1) platform ground, to illuminate as the turn signal flasher blinks the turn signal lights.

svcsubproc.title: Right Turn Indicator: 3000RE With International Turn Signal Switch
svcsubproc.para: When the turn signal switch is placed in the right turn position, power flows through the turn signal switch and orange/red wire, connector (13)/pin F, circuits 57 and 57B to the right turn indicator connector (11)/pin 12. This will cause the right turn indicator, grounded through connector (11)/pin 2 and circuits 28-G, 11-GB and 11-G to (J1) platform ground, to illuminate as the turn signal flasher blinks the turn signal lights.

svcsubproc.title: Right Turn Indicator: 3000RE With Douglas Tilt Column
svcsubproc.para: When the turn signal switch is placed in the right turn position, power flows through the turn signal switch and light blue wire, connector (13)/pin F, circuits 57 and 57B to the right turn indicator connector (11)/pin 12. This will cause the right turn indicator, grounded through connector (11)/pin 2 and circuits 28-G, 11-GB and 11-G to (J1) platform ground, to illuminate as the turn signal flasher blinks the turn signal lights.

svcsubproc.title: Water-In-Fuel: 2000/4000/8000 With International Engine
svcsubproc.para: With the key switch in the ignition or start position, the water-in-fuel module receives power at connector (432)/pin A from fuse F6, circuit 19J, connector (399), and circuits 19J and 19H. When the key switch is moved to the start position, a ground is applied to circuit 19N, the blocking diode, and circuit 19P going to the water-in-fuel module (432)/pin C. This initiates a bulb check by causing the module to apply power to connector (432)/pin B, circuit 19L, and the water-in-fuel warning light and connector (433). This causes the warning light, grounded through connector (433) and circuit 19-GA to cab ground, to illuminate. When water is detected in the fuel filter by the water probe, a ground path is completed to the water-in-fuel module (432)/pin D by circuit 19C, connector (399), circuit 19C, connector (2), circuit 19C, connector (401) and circuit 19C, thus causing the water-in-fuel warning light to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Water-In-Fuel: 3000FE
svcsubproc.para: With the key switch in the on or start position, the water-in-fuel module (16) receives power from fuse F20, and circuits 19D and 19E. When the key switch is moved to the start position, a ground is applied to circuit 19-GB going to the water-in-fuel module (16). This initiates a bulb check by causing the module to apply power to circuit 19F, and the water-in-fuel warning light and connector (9). This causes the warning light, grounded through connector (9) and circuits 19-G and 11-G to platform ground (J1), to illuminate. When water is detected in the fuel filter by the water probe, a ground path is completed to the water-in-fuel module (16) by circuit 19A, connector (2), circuit 19A, connector (39), and a yellow wire, thus causing the water-in-fuel warning light to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Water-In-Fuel: 3000RE
svcsubproc.para: With the key switch in the on or start position, the water-in-fuel module receives power at connector (470)/pin A from fuel heater relay (R5) and circuit 19E. When the key switch is moved to the start position, a ground is applied to circuit 19-GB going to the water-in-fuel module (470)/pin C. This initiates a bulb check by causing the module to apply power to connector (470)/pin B, circuit 19F, and the water-in-fuel module warning light (9). This causes the warning light, grounded through connector (9) and circuit 19-G to cab ground, to illuminate. When water is detected in the fuel filter by the water probe, a ground path is completed to the water-in-fuel module (470)/pin D by circuit 19C, connector (2), circuit 19C, connector (401), and circuit 19C, thus causing the water-in-fuel warning light to illuminate.

svcsubproc.title: Fuel Filter: 2000/4000/8000 Series With International Engines
svcsubproc.para: With the key switch in the on or start position, power is applied to fuse F6, circuit 19J, connector (399), and circuits 19J and 19K to the fuel filter warning light (434). When the fuel filter becomes restricted, the contacts of the fuel filter vacuum switch will close and the fuel filter warning light will illuminate as a ground path is applied through circuit 19B, connector (399), circuit 19B, connector (401), and circuit 19B to the switch and chassis ground.

svcsubproc.title: Fuel Filter: 3000RE
svcsubproc.para: With the key switch in the on or start position, power is applied to fuse F25 and circuit 19J to the fuel filter warning light (69). When the fuel filter becomes restricted, the contacts of the fuel filter vacuum switch will close and the fuel filter warning light will illuminate as a ground path is applied through circuit 19B, connector (2), circuit 19B, connector (401), and circuit 19B to the switch and chassis ground.

svcsubproc.title: Low Brake Fluid: 3000FE
svcsubproc.para: With the key switch in the on or start position, power is applied to fuse F22, circuits 28, 28A, and 90R to the low brake fluid warning light (89). With the key switch held in the start position, the low brake fluid warning light will illuminate as a bulb check is performed and a ground is applied through circuits 90V and 90W, blocking diode (82), and circuit 90X to the key switch ground.

When the key switch is in the ignition position and the brake fluid level is low, the contacts of the brake fluid level sensor (90) will close and the low brake fluid warning light will illuminate as a ground path is applied through circuits 90V and 90P, connector (84), circuit 90P, connector (88), circuit 90P, the closed sensor contacts, and circuit 11-GF to ground. A redundant ground circuit continues on from circuit 11-GF through circuit 11-GE, connector (88), circuit 11-GE, connector (84), and circuit 11-GE to ground.

svcsubproc.title: Low Brake Fluid: 3000RE
svcsubproc.para: With the key switch in the on or start position, power is applied to fuse F22, and circuits 28 and 90R to the low brake fluid warning light. With the key switch held in the start position, the low brake fluid warning light will illuminate (bulb check is performed) as a ground is applied through circuits 90V and 90W, blocking diode (82), and circuit 44-G (also 31-GD with pall trans. filter) to the key switch ground.

svcsubproc.title: Wait-to-Start: 2000/4000/8000 Series With International T 444E Engine
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch is initially moved to the ignition position on vehicles equipped with T 444E engines, the engine controller (379) will activate the glow plugs and apply a ground to pin 53. This will illuminate the wait to start warning light, which is fed battery power through connector (28)/pin 8, as a ground is applied to the light by connector (28) pin 5, circuit 18-G, connector (2), circuit 18-G, and ECM and connector (379) pin 53.

svcsubproc.title: Wait-to-Start: 3000RE With International T 444E Engine
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch is initially moved to the ignition position on vehicles equipped with T 444E engines, the engine controller (379) will activate the glow plugs and apply a ground to pin 53. This will illuminate the wait-to-start warning light, which is fed battery power through connector (12)/pin 8, as a ground is applied to the light by connector (12)/pin 5, circuit 18-G, and ECM and connector (379)/pin 53.

svcsubproc.title: ((P)) Low Air: 3000RE
svcsubproc.para: The "((P))"ark brake "LOW AIR" warning light is used with SE orders only, and will only briefly be covered. The light receives power through connector (12)/pin 8 and illuminates when a ground is applied through connector (12)/pin 9.

svcsubproc.title: PDL: 2000/4000/8000 Series
svcsubproc.para: The power divider lock (PDL) warning light is fed power from fuse F6, circuits 28 and 28C, and connector 28/pin 8. Thus when the power divider engages, the PDL switch will close and power will flow through the warning light, connector (28)/pin 9, circuit 43, the PDL switch, circuits 43-G and 11-GE to cab ground. This will cause the power divider lock (PDL) warning light to illuminate, indicating that the power divider lock has engaged.

svcsubproc.title: Parking Brake: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Hydraulic Brakes
svcsubproc.para: Power is applied by fuse 6 to circuits 28 and 28C and the park brake warning light and connector (28)/pin 8. When the parking brake is applied, power will flow through the warning light and connector (28)/pin 17, circuits 44 and 44A, connector (214), a black wire, connector (218), the park brake switch, connector (218), a white wire, connector (214), and circuit 44-G to ground. This will cause the park brake warning light to illuminate, indicating that the park brake is applied. With US and Canadian DRL, additional circuitry is connected between connector (214). The lamp will also illuminate when the key switch is moved to the start position, and a ground is applied through circuit 44A or 44B, performing a bulb check.

svcsubproc.title: Parking Brake: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Air Brakes
svcsubproc.para: Power is applied by fuse 6 to circuits 28 and 28C and the park brake warning light and connector (28)/pin 8. When the parking brake is applied, power will flow through the warning light and connector (28)/pin 17, circuits 44 and 66K, the park brake switch (168) and circuit 66-G to cab ground. This will cause the park brake warning light to illuminate, indicating that the park brake is applied. The lamp will also illuminate when the key switch is moved to the start position, and a ground is applied through circuit 66H, performing a bulb check.

svcsubproc.title: Parking Brake: 3000FE With Hydraulic Brakes
svcsubproc.para: Power is fed by fuse F22 to circuits 28 and 28C and the park brake warning light and connector (12)/pin 8. When the parking brake is applied, power will flow through the warning light and connector (12)/pin 17, circuit 44A, connector (2), circuits 44A and 44B, the park brake switch, and circuits 44-G and 11-GD to starter motor ground. This will cause the park brake warning light to illuminate, indicating that the park brake is applied. The lamp will also illuminate when the key switch is moved to the start position, and a ground is applied through circuit 44, connector (2), and circuit 44, performing a bulb check.

svcsubproc.title: Parking Brake: 3000RE With Hydraulic Brakes
svcsubproc.para: Power is fed by fuse F22 to circuits 28 and 28C and the park brake warning light and connector (12)/pin 8. When the parking brake is applied, power will flow through the warning light and connector (12)/pin 17, circuits 44 and 44A, the park brake switch (218), and circuits 44-GA, 11-GB, and 11-G to platform ground. This will cause the park brake warning light to illuminate, indicating that the park brake is applied. The lamp will also illuminate when the key switch is moved to the start position, and a ground is applied through circuit 44, a blocking diode (82), and circuit 44-G, performing a bulb check.

svcsubproc.title: Windshield Washer Fluid: 4000/8000 Series
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch is in the ignition or start position, power is applied by fuse F6, circuits 28 and 28H, and connector (28)/pin 13 to the low washer fluid warning light. When the washer fluid level becomes low, a magnetic float will close a reed switch, and power will flow through the warning light, connector (28)/pin 14, circuit 87D, the reed switch, and circuit 87-GA to mounting bracket ground stud. This will cause the warning light to illuminate, indicating that the washer fluid is low.

svcsubproc.title: Windshield Washer Fluid: 2000 Series
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch is in the ignition or start position, power is applied by fuse F6, circuits 28 and 28H, and connector (28)/pin 13 to the low washer fluid warning light. When the washer fluid level becomes low, a magnetic float will close a reed switch, and power will flow through the warning light, connector (28)/pin 14, circuit 87D, connector (2), circuit 87D, the reed switch, circuits 11-GJ and 11-GB, connector (2), and circuits 11-GB and 11-GF to cab ground. This will cause the warning light to illuminate, indicating that the washer fluid is low.

svcsubproc.title: Front Axle: 2000/4000/8000 Series
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch is in the ignition or start position, power from fuse F14 is applied to circuit 93, connector (14), circuits 93, 42, and 42C, and connector (28) pin 15 to the front axle engagement warning light. When the transfer case shifts to drive the front axle, the contacts of the warning light switch (708) will close and power will flow through the warning light, connector (28), circuit 42-GA, connector (13), a red wire, switch (708), and a brown wire to cab ground. This will cause the front axle warning light to illuminate, thus indicating that the transfer case is driving the front axle.

svcsubproc.title: Diff. Lock Engaged
svcsubproc.para: The Diff. Lock Engaged warning light is used with SE orders only, and will only briefly be covered. The light receives power through connector (28)/pin 8 and illuminates when a ground is applied through connector (28)/pin 6.

svcsubproc.title: Susp Low Air: 2000/4000/8000 Series With Hydraulic Brakes
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch is in the ignition or start position, power from fuse F6 is applied to circuits 28 and 28C, and susp low air warning light connector (28)/pin 8. Thus when the air pressure in the suspension system drops below 60 psi, the air pressure switch will close and power will flow through the air susp low warning light, connector (28)/pin 7, circuits 40-GC and 40-GB, switch (230), and circuit 61-GA to ground. This will cause the warning light to illuminate and the low air pressure alarm (117) to sound, thus indicating a problem with the air suspension and possibly preventing damage to the suspension and driveline components. The alarm receives power from fuse F30 and circuit 40B, and is switched to ground through circuit 40-GB as above with the warning light.
